importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: Kada Scott was reported missing on this date after leaving an overnight shift at an assisted living facility. The stolen Hyundai Accent was reported stolen the same day and later found on fire.

The remains of Kada Scott were found on this date behind an abandoned school. A news conference was held by District Attorney Larry Krasner, confirming the identity of the remains through DNA tests and outlining pending charges.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The stolen Hyundai Accent was seen on video at a recreation center on the evening of October 4, near where Scott’s body was later found. The car was reported on fire three days later, on October 7, and was compacted before inspection.

keyTakeAways: The remains of Kada Scott, a 23-year-old woman reported missing after an overnight shift at an assisted living facility, were discovered in a shallow grave behind an abandoned school in Philadelphia.
An anonymous tip led investigators back to the site, prompting a re-examination that resulted in the discovery of the remains, confirmed by DNA testing.
Keon King, 21, of Dover, Delaware, has been arrested and charged with kidnapping, stalking, arson, causing or risking a catastrophe, conspiracy, and possibly homicide. Bail was set at $2.5 million.

Prosecutors claim King had cellphone contact with Scott and that his phone locations correlated with her disappearance. Video evidence shows the stolen Hyundai Accent, which was seen parked near the area of the discovery, was later found on fire.
The black Hyundai Accent was reported stolen on October 4, one day before Scott went missing, and was seen on video near the recreation center on that night.
The vehicle was later reported on fire three days after the disappearance, and was compacted at a junkyard before investigators could examine it.

King was previously arrested in another case involving kidnapping and assault, though those charges were dropped due to lack of witness appearances. He is now facing new charges related to Scott’s case.
District Attorney Larry Krasner stated that homicide charges are expected, but emphasized that the prosecution must follow legal procedures and constitutional obligations.
Authorities believe others may have been involved in the incident after the initial crime, and that investigation into potential co-conspirators is ongoing.
Kada Scott’s parents described her as a source of 'light, kindness and beautiful spirit,' and expressed that their hearts were 'shattered' by her disappearance.

summaryOfNewsArticle: The remains of 23-year-old Kada Scott, a woman reported missing in Philadelphia after an overnight shift at an assisted living facility, were found in a shallow grave behind an abandoned school. The discovery, prompted by an anonymous tip that directed authorities to re-examine the site, was confirmed through DNA testing. Keon King, a 21-year-old man from Dover, Delaware, has been arrested and charged with kidnapping, stalking, arson, conspiracy, and potentially homicide. Investigators say King had cellphone contact with Scott, and his vehicle—a stolen black Hyundai Accent seen parked near the scene—was later found on fire. Additional charges are pending, and prosecutors indicate that others may have been involved in the incident. King was previously arrested in another case, but those charges were dropped. District Attorney Larry Krasner confirmed that homicide charges are being considered, though the legal process must follow constitutional standards.
